task: Fix issue #319 - Glb3DModel extraction adapter not registered
completion: Adapter appears in health endpoint extraction_strategies list AND 3D model extraction job succeeds
learnings: Blender support removed per user directive - only Three.js renderer pipeline is used
Three.js renderer bundled in Docker at localhost:8080
Adapter registers when vision backend exists, no longer requires Blender
health_check() verifies Three.js renderer at RENDERER_URL/health + vision backend
UAT tests no longer skip - Three.js renderer is always available in Docker bundle
Removed all Blender references from codebase, docs, and MCP tools
Always run cargo fmt before pushing to avoid CI lint failures
@pnpm/node-gyp is a pnpm internal package - NOT available on npm registry. Never add it as a dependency.

context.architecture: Three.js headless renderer with headless-gl for server-side WebGL
context.verification_needed: Run in Docker bundle to verify glb_3d_model appears in /health endpoint
